column4: So.. Evolution blows chunks and crashes every 30mins for me... Thunderbird 1.0(whatever it was) messes up my email ... Thunderbird 1.5.2(or whatever it is) does the same thing...is there any decent mail package for linux/ubuntu that even bloody works?
heh
Firefox 1.08 is one of the few things that so far.. hasn't given me trouble at all

This Dapper thing i hear about.. this is the next ubuntu version up? im running ubunty 5.10.. is it easy to upgrade/migrate or is it better to re-install from cd/dvd ? or should I not bother with Dapper? whats different?
easy to upgrade
whats different... just later packages?
more like.. debian sid/unstable ?
be like going from sarge to sid ?
newer packages, more work done on making it user friendly, is faster, and will be supported for approximately eleventy billion years
ok so only 3 years of support, but that's a lifetime
yep. so i should upgrade?
when it goes stable, yeah
i would recommend that :)
ive been playing with Debian "unstable" for years. prefer that because the packages are much newer
so if its like that.. i might as well gib that a go
heh, i hated unstable
when i ran debian, i was one of the few who actually ran stable
do u run Dapper now?
yes, in fact im running dapper beta, oddly enough
well i certainly don't run unstable on my colo server... its not for playing with :P
i dont plan on upgrading until the next long term service release comes out, though :)
ok.. so I take it I just need to change some apt sources, apt-get update, and dist-upgrade and its on the way.. or is there more too it? hrm.
!upgrade
check out the links
